header.title: Block Tags

chapter.p: Block tags typically define a separate block of information, such as a paragraph or a list.

The following subset of block tags are common for all DTDs in the OTP DTD suite:

, 

,
    ,

section.title: <codeinclude> - Code Inclusion
section.p: Include external code snippets. The attribute file gives the file name and tag defines a string which delimits the code snippet. Example:
results in:
provided there is a file named examples.txt looking like this:
section.code:
...
%% Erlang example -module(example).
start() -> {error,"Pid required!"}. start(Pid) -> spawn(fun() -> init(Pid) end). %% Erlang example
...
section.p: If the tag attribute is omitted, the whole file is included.
There is also an attribute type = "erl" | "c" | "none", but currently this attribute is ignored. Default value is "none"

section.title: <marker> - Marker
section.p: Used as an anchor for hypertext references. The <marker> tag is both a block- and an inline tag and is described in the Inline Tags section.

section.title: - Paragraph
section.p: Paragraphs contain plain text and inline tags. Example:
section.pre: I call specific attention to the authority given by the 21st Amendment to the Constitution to prohibit transportation or importation of intoxicating liquors into any State in violation of the laws of such State.
section.p: results in:

I call specific attention to the authority given by the 21st Amendment to the Constitution to prohibit transportation or importation of intoxicating liquors into any State in violation of the laws of such State.

section.title: <note> - Note
section.p: Highlights a note. Can contain block tags except <note>, <warning>, <image> and <table>. Example:
section.pre: This function is mainly intended for debugging.
section.p: results in:

note.p: This function is mainly intended for debugging.

section.title: <pre> - Pre-formatted Text
section.p: Used for documentation of system interaction. Can contain text, seealso, url and <input> tags.
The <input> tag is used to highlight user input. Example:
section.pre:
$ erl
Erlang (BEAM) emulator version 5.5.3 [async-threads:0] [hipe] [kernel-poll:false]

Eshell V5.5.3  (abort with ^G)
1> pwd().
/home/user
2> halt().
section.p: results in:
section.pre:
$ erl Erlang (BEAM) emulator version 5.5.3 [async-threads:0] [hipe] [kernel-poll:false]
Eshell V5.5.3 (abort with ^G) 1> pwd(). /home/user 2> halt().
section.p: All character entities are expanded.

section.title: <quote> - Quotation
section.p:
Highlight quotations from other works, or dialog spoken by characters in a narrative. Contains one or more

tags. Example:
section.pre:
Whereas Section 217(a) of the Act of Congress entitled "An Act ..." approved June 16, 1933, provides as follows:

Section 217(a) The President shall proclaim the law.
section.p: results in:
Whereas Section 217(a) of the Act of Congress entitled "An Act ..." approved June 16, 1933, provides as follows:

quote.p: Section 217(a) The President shall proclaim the law.

section.title: <taglist> - Definition List
section.p: Definition lists contains pairs of tags, <tag>, and list items, <item>.
<tag> can contain plain text, <c>, <em>, <seealso> and <url> tags.

section.title: <warning> - Warning
section.p: Highlights a warning. Can contain block tags except <note>, <warning>, <image> and <table>. Example:
section.pre: This function might be removed in a future version without prior warning.
section.p: results in:

warning.p: This function might be removed in a future version without prior warning.

section.p: Graphics is imported using the <image> tag. An image caption <icaption>, containing plain text, must be supplied. Example:

section.title: <table> - Table
section.p: The table format is similar to how tables are described in HTML 3.2. A table contains one or more rows, <row>, and a table caption <tcaption>, containing plain text.

Each row contains one or more cells, <cell>. The attributes align = "left"|"center"|"right" and valign = "top"|"middle"|"bottom" decides how text is aligned in the cell horizontally and vertically. Default is "left" and "middle".
Each cell contains plain text and inline tags. Example:
section.pre: Boys Girls Juda Susy Anders Victoria A table caption
